result.execSummary:
The defendant Jerry W. Greene was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jerry W. Greene is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jerry W. Greene was found guilty of Child Enticement-Expose Genitals/Pubic Area/Intimate Parts, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Due in 30 days or civil judgment.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Counseling shall specifically include: Sex Offender Treatment.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   If unpaid financial obligations remain at discharge or revocation, civil judgment to be entered.
*   Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not have contact with anyone under 18 yoa, unless otherwise permitted by the court/agent.  May not possess any weapons, including firearms.  Register as a sex offender for 15 years following probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Victims grandfather present.  Court withholds sentence and places deft on probation for 6 years w/conditions; 1 year conditional jail w/Huber privileges is stayed; credit for 387 days served if revoked; no contact with anyone under age 18; deft to submit DNA sample and pay $250 DNA surcharge; 30 DTP costs or civil judgment.

Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney D Hertz-McGrath.  Clerk/H. Barnett.  Conference held off the record w/Judge concerning alleged victim's whereabouts; State was unable to obtain medical records to produce to defense.  Atty McGrath places offer on the record that she gave to ADA McNeill that she claims was accepted and later rejected.  Court instructs ADA McNeill to make a demand that this court be allowed to use documents involving 12JM23A, 12JM23B, 12JM23C, 14ME217 & 14ME217A.  Atty McGrath makes oral motion to modify bond.  ADA McNeill states she would like time to address speedy trial demand before bond would be addressed; disagrees that she accepted any offer made by defense.  Court amends bond to a $10,000 signature bond w/conditions: *No Contact w/ARW (dob 10-24-96) or her residence or ARW's parents, either directly or by 3rd party  *No access to a computer except for employment purposes, no chat rooms  *Cell phone internet use for employment purposes only.  Atty McGrath's suppression motion continued.  Testimony taken from:  KSD Lt. Tom Gilley.  MH continued to 10/9/15 at 11am; the JS of 9/8/15 is removed from the calendar.
940.225(2)(c) - 2ns degree sexual assault  /  948.07(3) - Child enticement
